text: Augustus Octavius Bacon (October 20, 1839February 14, 1914) was an American politician. He was a Democratic Party U.S. Senator from Georgia. He was also President pro tempore of the United States Senate. He was a supporter of segregation.Stephanie Barron, Jessica Carrier, Chad Moore, William Sanders, and Andrew Smith, "The Case over Baconsfield Park," Remembering the Civil Rights Movement, c. 2012. ==References== Category:1839 births Category:1914 deaths Category:Presidents pro tempore of the United States Senate Category:United States senators from Georgia Category:State legislators of the United States Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
title: Augustus Octavius Bacon
